greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = A099563(A000407(n)); the most significant digit in factorial base representation of (2n+1)! / n!.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10080
Antti Karttunen, Scatter-plot of the graph drawn for the terms n=0 .. 1024, with the help of OEIS-plot utility
Index entries for sequences related to factorial base representation
example: The terms A000407(0) .. A000407(8) in factorial base representation (A007623) look as:
Taking the first digit (actually: a place holder value) of each gives the terms a(0) .. a(8) of this sequence: 1, 1, 2, 1, 3, 8, 2, 6, 1, ...
program: A099563(n) = { my(i=2,dig=0); until(0==n, dig = n % i; n = (n - dig)/i; i++); return(dig); };
(define (A265891 n) (A265890bi (+ 1 n) (+ 1 n))) ;; Code for A265890bi given in A265890.
xref: Main diagonal of A265890 (apart from the corner term).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Dec 20 2015
